ACUTELY.Defintion: feeling or noticing something very strongly

ADVOCATES.Defintion: someone who publicly supports an idea

BANNED.Defintion: forbidden, not allowed to be used

BUFF.Defintion: someone who knows a lot about something and is interested in it

DESCENDED.Defintion: come from, to be related to

FELLOW.Defintion: someone with the same interests or job as you

GET BY.Defintion: manage, be able to deal with a situation

HOBBYIST.Defintion: something that people do in their free time

INTELLECTUAL.Defintion: relating to a desire to understand things

LENDS ITSELF.Defintion: is naturally a good fit for

LINGUISTIC.Defintion: relating to language or the study of language

MELTING POT.Defintion: a place with many different people, cultures, religions and ideas

NETWORK EFFECTS.Defintion: a situation when anyone who does the same thing adds value to the entire community

NICHE.Defintion: something enjoyed by a small amount of people

NOBLE.Defintion: good in an honest and brave sense

PLAGUED.Defintion: cause pain and suffering to (for a long time)

PLOT.Defintion: a secret plan by a group of people

PRECURSOR.Defintion: something that happened before something else

PSEUDONYM.Defintion: a name used instead of a real name

ROUNDED UP.Defintion: found and forced to go to prison or jail

THEORISED.Defintion: thought that something could be explained by something else

TONES.Defintion: different ways of pronouncing the same syllable

YIDDISH.Defintion: a language related to German that is spoken by some Jewish people, especially in Eastern Europe
